result: Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large bowl, cream brown sugar and melted butter. Add vanilla and eggs 1 at a time. In a separate bowl, sift flour, powder, and salt. Add dry mixture into wet mixture. Spread into a greased glass baking dish. Cook in oven until golden, 15-18 minutes. In a microwave safe bowl, heat peanut butter and cream on low heat. Stir until smooth, and spread over baked bars. Cool slightly and cut into squares.

Heat a large saucepan over a low heat and add the butter. When the butter has melted, add the mushrooms, season with salt and pepper to taste, then increase the heat and stir. When the moisture from the mushrooms has been released, allow it to evaporate, concentrating the flavour. This might happen quickly or slowly, depending entirely on the type of mushrooms used. Add teh paprika and cayenne and fry for a few moments longer, until the paprika turns a shade darker. Finally, add teh sour cream or creme fraiche and dill, and allow it to bubbvle gently for a further 5 minutes or so.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spread turkey in a casserole dish. Top with green beans and mushrooms. Spread the turkey in the bottom of a buttered 9x13-inch casserole dish. Spread the soup over the meat and vegetable mixture. Crumble the stuffing and spread evenly over the top. Bake at 350f for 25-30 minutes or until heated through and bubbly.

Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken, and sprinkle with pepper flakes. Stir fry 3 minutes. Add vegetables and teriyaki sauce. Stir fry 5 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender and chicken is thoroughly cooked.

In a large pot of boiling, salted water cook the pasta to al dente and drain. Return to the pot and melt in the butter. Toss to coat. Whisk together the eggs, milk, hot sauce, salt, pepper, and mustard. Stir into the pasta and add the cheese. Over low heat continue to stir for 3 minutes or until creamy.

Heat oven to 400f. Cook sausage in nonstick skillet over medium heat until browned, stirring frequently. Drain. Add pepper and cook 3 minute stir in pizza sauce. Spread sausage mixture on pizza crust. Sprinkle with french onions and cheese. Bake pizza on baking sheet. Bake 10 to 12 minute until cheese melts and crust is golden an crispy. Cut into wedges to serve.

Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the chicken is thoroughly cooked, there is no pink meat and the juices run clear when pierced with a sharp knife. In a wok or large frying pan over medium high heat, saute the hawaiian rice in the oil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350f for 8 to 10 minutes or until light golden brown.

Heat olive oil, lemon peel, lemon juice, herbs, and s&p into a large ziplock bag. Add shrimp. Toss gently to coat. Cover, and refrigerate for one hour to marinate. Place pork tenderloin in a slow cooker with the contents of the soup packet. Pour water, wine, and soy sauce over the top, turning the pork to coat. Sprinkle with pepper, cover, and cook on low setting for 4 hours. Serve with cooking liquid on the side as au jus.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Spread bottom crust in a 9 inch pie pan. Spread berry mixture in pie shell. Sprinkle cinnamon on top. Dot butter on top. Put top crust on and seal edges. In a large, heavy bottomed skillet, place the sugar and water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the almonds and cook, stirring constantly, until the sugar has dried on the almonds. About 2 minutes. Pour onto a large sheet pan and let cool.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add asparagus and cook, stirring, until just tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir the asparagus. Toss to coat and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Grease 8x8x2-inch baking pan. In large bowl beat butter and sugar until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Beat in chocolate, then flour. Stir in walnuts. Spread evenly into prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until firm.

In a small saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a light boil. Cook and stir for 2 mins. Pour into a large container. Add pineapple juice, concentrates and extract. Cover and freeze. Place all ingredients in a sauce pot. Cook on high heat until mixture starts to boil. Stirring occasionally until berries pop. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add in the sugars. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the milk, syrup, and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Use immediately or store, covered, at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.

Toast bread in toaster to desired level. Put butter on one slice and mayo on the other. Put cheese in between slices of bread. Wrap a moist papertowel around sandwich and put in microwave for 20 sec. Enjoy.

When the sauce begins to bubble, add all the chicken thighs back into the skillet, spooning sauce over them to coat, cover and reduce heat to medium low. Cover and cook an additional 5 minutes or more, until chops are cooked through, but still very slightly pink inside. Remove chops to serving platter or individual plates. Preheat oven to 325f place pears in 2 large baking dishes. Spoon 1 teaspoon jam in center of each pears half. Top with goat cheese rounds, and lightly drizzle with oil. Combine the coleslaw mix and onion in a large bowl. Whisk together the mustard, white vinegar, and salt in a medium bowl. Blend thoroughly. Pour dressing mixture over coleslaw mix and toss to coat. Chill at least 2 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Arrange sweet potatoes in an even layer in a 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish. Combine maple syrup, butter, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Uncover, stir and cook, stirring every 15 minutes, until tender and starting to turn brown, 45 to 50 minutes more.

Mix together catsup and mustard with ground beef. Fill each biscuit cup with meat mixture. Sprinkle cheese over all. Fold dough over top. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray cookie sheet with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda and salt. Stir in corn syrup and egg whites until throughly blended. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls, about 1 inch apart onto prepared sheets. Bake 7 to 9 minutes, or until set. Remove cookies to wire rack to cool completely.

Heat oil in 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook turkey, onion, chilies and garlic in oil, stirring occasionally, until turkey is no longer pink in center and onion is tender. Stir in remaining ingredients. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 13x9 pan with pam. Put hash browns in pan and add salt and pepper to taste. Top with grated cheese and pour half and half over top. Drizzle with melted butter. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place the black olives in a large bowl and bake until just crisp, about 10 minutes. Let cool. Pour the olive oil in a steady stream until combined. Sprinkle with the crisp prosciutto crumbles, toss again, and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Stir ingredients in medium mixing bowl until blended. Spoon onto 2 un-greased cookie sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Allow the cookies to cool on the pan, or wait 1-2 minutes before moving to cooling racks. Cookies should be soft & chewy.

Heat oil with cornstarch in saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook for 1 minute. Add in chicken pieces and can of green chilies. Mix well and add cream cheese. Put mixture in a 13 x 9 baking pan, top with 1 cup of grated cheese pour the whipping cream over the top and then put the last cup of grated cheese over that. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or so, checking to make sure the cheese gets bubbly, not burnt.

Cook pasta according to directions on package, drain and cool by running cool water over it. Let drain thoroughly. Combine pasta with peppers, carrots and parsley. Add vinaigrette and mix well. Add feta cheese, mix lightly, lifting the pasta and cheese mixture until the cheese is distributed throughout. Chill for an hour before serving.

Cook and drain meatballs, cheese and cheese mixture. Add cheese mixture to meatballs. Bake at 375 for 30-35 minutes or until heated through. Top with extra onions and cheese. Bake another 3-5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute the beef and onion for 5 to 10 minutes, or until meat is browned and onion is tender. Drain fat. When cooked, place them in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour the meat mixture over the noodles, stirring well. Top with the cheese. Simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until mixture is hot and tomatoes are soft. Toss sauce with hot cooked angel hair pasta to coat. Serve with parmesan cheese.

Place fish in a shallow baking pan. Combine french dressing, lemon juice and salt. Pour sauce over fish and let stand 30 minutes, turning once. Heat oil in skillet on med, add peas, cook until soft. Add peas. Cook until peas are heated through. Stir in celery leaves, salt and pepper.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Spray muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray. Add one cracked egg to each tin and whisk the yolk. Add your toppings, saving the cheese for last. Bake 30 minutes or until eggs are completely cooked. Cool and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, butter, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, flour. Whisk the lemon juice, lemon zest, dill, olive oil and honey together in a small bowl. Top the asparagus with some of the dressing and keep the rest on the side.

In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add in the sugars. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the milk, syrup, and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl, toss the nuts with the maple syrup, olive oil, herbs and cayenne. Spread the nuts on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes., stirring occasionally, until browned. Season the nuts with salt and pepper and toss frequently until cooled.

In a large non-stick skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Add onions. Once onions begin to brown reduce heat to low. Continue to cook onions until soft and caramelized. This should take a total of 20-30 minutes. Roll dough out. Spread pesto. Layer remaining ingredients and onions over sauce. Bake according to dough directions.

Place salmon on a broiler pan and baste with the sauce. Let sit for 15 minutes. Broil them until cooked through, about 8 minutes, basting again with the glaze. Remove the salmon from the heat and baste once more with the glaze before serving.
